page.title: 13A day in the life of mum
page.content: Each day I get up at 7.45am. I prepare breakfast for my husband malcolm, and my two children richards and amanda. My husband then leaves for work, and Richard and Amanda get ready to go to school while I wash up the breakfast dishes, and tidy up the kitchen. After the children leave for school I do any odd jobs that I have time to do beore I leave for work at five minutes to nine. I start work at nine o'clock at John Menzies the newspaper wholesales in York Street, Penrith. I work in the ofice and my job involves operating a VDU answering the telephone and dealing with customers who call in he office to pay their accounts. I leave work at one o'clock and usually visit my mother, who is an old age pensioner, and lives by herself. After a cup of coffee and a chat, I call at the shops for any
